snippet.textDisplay:
i am totally impressed about the game. This game is more than darksouls but less than eldenring in terms of scale. kind of in between. with the amount of secret and lore you can find in the game, its a 6 month worth of content. its crazy even! what I don't like is a time pressure when navigating in the dead world. the timer feels like a meh feature. if they want to keep the death timer thing in umbral world, they should remove the exit points.

ultimately the game plays and feels like a true souls game. 10/10! will watch youtubers gameplays again!

I came in to see your review on “Lords of the Fallen” today, because I really wanted to hear your thoughts on the game play.
 Because I have been reading your reviews for 1001 one years with WOW, I know they are based on what you hope to find in any game, respectfully having an extremely awesome degree of playing skills.

For anyone who will read or watch your online gaming skills, if you just listen to the first 2 minutes of the review and comments, this one sentence  is GOLDEN :
“Make the decision for yourself” 

Please step forward and take a bow for that thought….. everyone should always do just that 😊

THANK YOU !
JJ

Only the started pack does when you hover over it; the Agility pack or Str pack for example have no info. What is recommended; what is a good value? do I have to buy them all at once? are they all compatible with the 2.0 upgrade? how much do they change game play? I would like it if when you play a game like this and give a review; you say the details of the game your playing; is this just base 2.0? or do you have upgrades, so please give us these specs before you start so we are all on the same page.

snippet.textDisplay: i liked lords of the fallen when it 1st came out, wasnt the best, but i tend to like 6/10 games. then they decided to add the new modifiers which i think all games should add more cool modifiers/features like them, even tho how they did the randomizer when it released wasn't great. another thing fromsoft and other souls copycats can learn from this is adding a ng+0 option, but i would like if it gave the option to go ng+0 with resetting lvl so u can essentially start a new playthrough with all the gear. elden ring is good, but im not a fan of having to spend the entire time getting the gear to play through the game again with different equipment. and no i dnt like ng+ past like ng+2 in elden ring, giving the enemies more hp and damage dsnt increase my fun.
snippet.textOriginal: i liked lords of the fallen when it 1st came out, wasnt the best, but i tend to like 6/10 games. then they decided to add the new modifiers which i think all games should add more cool modifiers/features like them, even tho how they did the randomizer when it released wasn't great. another thing fromsoft and other souls copycats can learn from this is adding a ng+0 option, but i would like if it gave the option to go ng+0 with resetting lvl so u can essentially start a new playthrough with all the gear. elden ring is good, but im not a fan of having to spend the entire time getting the gear to play through the game again with different equipment. and no i dnt like ng+ past like ng+2 in elden ring, giving the enemies more hp and damage dsnt increase my fun.

Wife and I picked this game up to play together. We do love it but the netcode is really bad, latency just every 10 seconds unfortunately. So we're gonna still wait until they fix that, which we have no doubt will be fixed as they are listening to the feedback so much and everyone seems to be having this problem.

snippet.textDisplay:
I wouldn't agree with the statement that these changes were "finally" made. Is anyone familiar with the incredible weapon level scaling option added that has never been seen before? It's perfect for the Souls-Like genre and was released prior to the 2.0 Difinitive Edition update. These developers have been making improvements to the game since its release, against the insurmountable negative feedback from players and streamers alike.

While the game has its flaws, I played it to the end. I encountered 30+ crashes (no, my AMD rig was not terrible), and I was very disappointed with the ending. However, it was still a very fun experience overall. I will certainly be pre-ordering the next installment.
snippet.textOriginal:
I wouldn't agree with the statement that these changes were "finally" made. Is anyone familiar with the incredible weapon level scaling option added that has never been seen before? It's perfect for the Souls-Like genre and was released prior to the 2.0 Difinitive Edition update. These developers have been making improvements to the game since its release, against the insurmountable negative feedback from players and streamers alike.

While the game has its flaws, I played it to the end. I encountered 30+ crashes (no, my AMD rig was not terrible), and I was very disappointed with the ending. However, it was still a very fun experience overall. I will certainly be pre-ordering the next installment.

snippet.textDisplay:
Lords of the Fallen 2.0 has made some great improvements! 

Having purchased this game on release I’m finally starting to feel like I got my money’s worth. 

Game does needs a bit more work though.

My experience on PS5. 

1. Walking animations have a shaky jitter. I tried 2 different controllers with same outcome. So it wasn’t a stick drift issue. 

2. Visceral attacks, the ones with the prompt, don’t always work, even when locked-on. I noticed this issue more on dogs. It was almost 50/50. 

3. If you mess with any setting the game will continue to ask if you want to save before progressing, even if you put setting back and didn’t make a change. 

4. The HUD button layout is incorrect and doesn’t properly convey the controller layout.

5. Main menu still shows our character with no shirt for a brief second. It’s been like this since launch.

6. The Knock down animation for our main character is very poor and cartoony looking. 

7. Your can’t cancel a bow string pull by just releasing the L2 button, you have to dodge instead. 

8. There is major graphical clipping with capes and shields.

9. If you fall off a tall ledge the game’s camera literally rollercoasters back to the path where you leaped off. Looks a bit silly.

10. Enemies get stuck and float in environment a bit too frequent. 

11. Soft-lock sword attacks overshoot targets. 

I can definitely see the improvements with this 2.0 update. But overall game still needs a bit more help.

I played this game at launch then again a year later at version 1.7 and I was blown away. Then I visited the Reddit threads that the devs created  to see patch notes and I noticed they’ve been working non stop to listen to the gamers and catered the game to what we want.

to be honest, looks like they made it better, but they also made it worse.
I appreciate that the Umbral is easier, and the normal mobs easier(may be even a bit too easy), but why they gotta make the bosses easier too. I played the launch version, and basically the only complain I had, aside from optimization issue, is the bosses are too anti-climatically easy.
And in this new version, to see Asmon spam attack, attack, attack, and still win against every boss is concerning.

snippet.textDisplay: feedback: Have a look online at all the controls that you have, like kick, combo between 1 and 2 swords, the parry actually works better then elden ring even with the most shitty shields that you got at the start, use the lamp to push the enemy where you want, you can parry even with two swords which will decrees enemy stamina. L1+R1 gives the kick, and L1+R2 uses special attacks, showing that even how the female looks now won't be that bad. The studio works a lot to fix the game with no additional costs. A better showcase for a Western studio that decided to fight the ongoing narrative and propose something more dynamic than the dogging, dogging, dogging, hit and repeat (like Elden Ring  DLC) will be more helpful.

snippet.textDisplay: While I think it's great that the devs and the company are listening to the people, and actually going through and fixing things.  I do find it quite hilarious that his game is now having a second 2.0 release.  The first 1.x launched like trash, so they fixed it... and re-released it as a 1.0 (again), and now it's got such an overhaul (again), that they've called it 2.0... without actually releasing an expansion.  However, while it seems I'm hating on the game, it's a gripe against the label.  I did buy the game, and I do plan on playing a LOT of this. :)

snippet.textDisplay: i recently got the 5070ti.. i agree with jensen.. it actually kind of is like 4090 performance.. im getting way better numbers than the reviewers ive seen but i got the gigabyte gaming oc model.. the cooler is twice as big as the stock model.. its a 3 dimm slot.. i used to have a 1080 and i would push that thing to the limit without overclocking any chance i could.. the game would tell me im running out of vram and i would tell the game to ess me off and give me maximum.. i literally didnt care and i got away with it for the longest time.. with this 5070 ti its like that but i can turn on full ray tracing.. and the dlss 4 is actually good.. it doesnt look bunk like lossless scaling 4x.. i still try to only use 2x when possible but its nice knowing that i have that extended ability in the future if needed.. oh and i can run monster hunter wilds in maximum native with no dlss or frame generation.. i heard everyones talking about that game wrecking their computers.. someone else already told me im lying and its impossible but scouts honor bro.. im literally not lying.. 4k ultra maximum native.. no bs..
snippet.textOriginal: i recently got the 5070ti.. i agree with jensen.. it actually kind of is like 4090 performance.. im getting way better numbers than the reviewers ive seen but i got the gigabyte gaming oc model.. the cooler is twice as big as the stock model.. its a 3 dimm slot.. i used to have a 1080 and i would push that thing to the limit without overclocking any chance i could.. the game would tell me im running out of vram and i would tell the game to ess me off and give me maximum.. i literally didnt care and i got away with it for the longest time.. with this 5070 ti its like that but i can turn on full ray tracing.. and the dlss 4 is actually good.. it doesnt look bunk like lossless scaling 4x.. i still try to only use 2x when possible but its nice knowing that i have that extended ability in the future if needed.. oh and i can run monster hunter wilds in maximum native with no dlss or frame generation.. i heard everyones talking about that game wrecking their computers.. someone else already told me im lying and its impossible but scouts honor bro.. im literally not lying.. 4k ultra maximum native.. no bs..

snippet.textDisplay: Why are you playing so late? This game had supposed issues at launch. They've been making updates all the time since release. The only thing that was annoying was the gravity deaths on edges. They fixed that immediately. I played and beat this game 3 times with 3 different builds. From the day it was released I put it as the #1 souls like thats not from From. Lies of P is always put in that #1 position but I think cause of it's super similarity with not that much difference from actual souls games makes it #2. LOTF has a way better throwable item and magic system that fromsoftware should copy. Being able to pull up all your spells or throwables and then launch them with your face buttons is way better than scrolling thru a deep list of spells and heals while being viciously attacked especially in SOTE. Idk I've been thought this game was way cooler than any souls like before it.

snippet.textDisplay:
The game was good from the start.

Major QoL updates for sure!

Bosses, customization, scenes, world feel is all the same. 

What got changed is its made easier to pickup:

Tutorial
Less annoying archer mobs
Less mob placements
Lower boss dmg
More stagger (impactful feel)
More responsive runspeed
slower combat (more realistic)
Other QoL 

AND COOP!

Overall its made more fun instead of "tedious"

Thats why everyone now is positive. The "tedious/annoying" parts are gone.

Go enjoy! Play with friends! Have great fun and make memories!

snippet.textDisplay: I'm actually glad people are giving this game a chance. I did early on and enjoyed it quite a bit. The somewhat lackluster bosses were never a concern for me since I was really looking for that old Demon's Souls/Dark Souls exploration. The devs did a pretty good job in that regard. Plus there's some cool weapons and environments. I do have problems with the game such as enemy variety towards the end and a few other nitpicks. Fortunately, it seems the devs are interested in hearing feedback and creating the best experience they can. Looking forward to see what their next game it.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm actually glad people are giving this game a chance. I did early on and enjoyed it quite a bit. The somewhat lackluster bosses were never a concern for me since I was really looking for that old Demon's Souls/Dark Souls exploration. The devs did a pretty good job in that regard. Plus there's some cool weapons and environments. I do have problems with the game such as enemy variety towards the end and a few other nitpicks. Fortunately, it seems the devs are interested in hearing feedback and creating the best experience they can. Looking forward to see what their next game it.

snippet.textDisplay:
Much respect to the lords of the fallen crew they truly care about the game an about the players that play it and not listen to some one with clip board saying no this is what ppl want, when it wasn't true at all.

I played the game when it dropped on my ps5, I my self enjoyed it, sure it had its problems but they listen an worked on fixing those areas as fast as they could.
But the core of the game an design was good an so was the combat an the world design.

The fact they held a real poll that made ppl mad we know the ones that don't even play the game.
 but it showed what real gamers wanted by a land side of 99% that voted, you gotta respect them for that alone an did it, almost no devs out there in the game indy will do that, an we all know why.

I my self will be picking up a 2nd copy for my pc now even tho I already have it on ps5 since day 1, just cause I support Devs that are for the love of making the game good an are for the gamers that support them.
These are the type of Devs gamers should support, we need more people like them back in the Game indy.

snippet.textDisplay: It's improved a lot indeed. Finally the game somehow recovered every single of my characters. In a later big patch all of it were gone with my roughly 35 hours in so I had enough and put it on the shelf. But now I tried again and it is a lot better but I think I am able to find the weirdest shit in this game. For example I joined to a guy, he disconnected but I was stuck in his "save file". It overwrote my seedling and I got his unlocked vestiges which I am certain I did not unlock previously. (The common mob literally 1 shot me there.) Even my loot got a reset and I looted a second of the same weapon from a chest in 1 playthrough while the bosses I killed on the route did not reset.

snippet.textDisplay:
I'd 100% be in favor of "incomplete/broken at launch but WILL be perfected over time" as a compromise to games simply being fully complete at launch, but only if the games had as dedicated studios as CI Games and Larian. 
I'm so glad people are giving LoF more love despite such a rocky launch, cuz the devs probably feel like sticking it out was worth it and it shows that dedicating to improving a game with issues via player feedback as opposed to pump 'n dumping and ditching it after launch.
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: To explain to people about the DLSS and image scaling situation. Image scaling is disabled with DLSS, it was not affecting the visuals. What was affecting the visuals was the fact that he had DLSS set to Balanced (a 2k image scaled into 800p) instead of Quality (a 2k image scaled a bit under 1080p) and had his sharpness lowered to 0.25. to get a good fps bump with little to no picture lost, you want 2k Quality with sharpness at about 80 (adjust it to your liking) anything under quality is going to show image loss and you should only use it if you have to.
snippet.textOriginal: To explain to people about the DLSS and image scaling situation. Image scaling is disabled with DLSS, it was not affecting the visuals. What was affecting the visuals was the fact that he had DLSS set to Balanced (a 2k image scaled into 800p) instead of Quality (a 2k image scaled a bit under 1080p) and had his sharpness lowered to 0.25. to get a good fps bump with little to no picture lost, you want 2k Quality with sharpness at about 80 (adjust it to your liking) anything under quality is going to show image loss and you should only use it if you have to.

snippet.textDisplay: I first got this game a couple of months ago and played it a lot.  It was already obvious by then, from what I saw people saying and such, it had been massively improved.  One of the things I love about this game is how they handle dual wielding.  You don't need to have two weapons of the same type.  You just a weapon in each hand.  The weapons you are using can change the attack animations in ways that make sense given the differences between the weapons.  Meaning if you have a huge sword and a smaller sword, it will be different compared to two regular swords but it still works.
snippet.textOriginal: I first got this game a couple of months ago and played it a lot.  It was already obvious by then, from what I saw people saying and such, it had been massively improved.  One of the things I love about this game is how they handle dual wielding.  You don't need to have two weapons of the same type.  You just a weapon in each hand.  The weapons you are using can change the attack animations in ways that make sense given the differences between the weapons.  Meaning if you have a huge sword and a smaller sword, it will be different compared to two regular swords but it still works.

snippet.textDisplay:
i love TLotF, played the hell outta it at launch, but sadly the devs said the 2nd game is going to be an epic excluisive and im not touching epic

i even beat the game with all modifyers on it when that patcj launched and got all the achievements for the modifyers all in one run. Took so many damn tries but once you get past the first few areas there is only a few spots later in the game you have to watch out for and also of course mimics. The boss battle before the final boss i was sweating bullets, and even the gimmick final boss fight is a bit scary on hardcore mode.

The game still has one of the best trailers in all of gaming imo, the music and timing of it was perfect along with the Joseph Quinn's great narration

snippet.textDisplay: I 100% this game on PS5 when it came out and really enjoyed my time with it for the most part! Getting the last few “collectible” trophies was an absolute pain in the dick because of the drop rates for some of the gear pieces especially at launch. I believe they fixed some of the drop rates but I haven’t played it since as I got pretty burnt out on those last few trophies. Over all it was a great game to ME and had a really interesting departure from the regular Souls formula with the 2 different worlds and the lamp. I hope more people give this gem a chance now that the devs have ironed everything out and after my replay of Lies of P I’ll probably boot it up again. Edit: Giant kudos to the Devs for their continued support and the way they actually listened to the community! More devs need to lead by example in this manner.

snippet.textDisplay:
While I was initially very hyped for this game, I have been absolutely spoiled by Bloodborne, Sekiro and Elden Ring. Because hearing the sound effects of the character getting hit or the enemies getting hit, sounds like wet cardboard.

No bass or weight to them at all. Audio is a big deal to me in games and I notice it a lot. If I’m playing a SoulsLike or an actual FromSoft game, I want good audio design. 

But I’m happy the dev is listening to fans and put a ton more work into their game, congrats!
snippet.textOriginal:
While I was initially very hyped for this game, I have been absolutely spoiled by Bloodborne, Sekiro and Elden Ring. Because hearing the sound effects of the character getting hit or the enemies getting hit, sounds like wet cardboard.

No bass or weight to them at all. Audio is a big deal to me in games and I notice it a lot. If I’m playing a SoulsLike or an actual FromSoft game, I want good audio design. 

But I’m happy the dev is listening to fans and put a ton more work into their game, congrats!

snippet.textDisplay:
Lords of the Fallen, even with this 2.0 update, is not good. I think this game probably needs like another year.

My experience on PS5. 

1. Walking animations have shaky jitter. I even tried with different controllers and it was the same. 

2. Visceral attacks, the ones with the prompt, don’t always work, even when locked-on. I noticed this issue more on dogs. It was almost 50/50. 

3. If you mess with any setting the game will continue to ask if you want to save before progressing, even if you put setting back and didn’t make a change. 

4. The stock controller layouts for magic or projectiles are a mess. You have to spend time in the button re-map menu to make it right. 

5. Our character glitch appears with no shirt every single time on main menu. 

6. Knock down animation for our main character is straight up lazy and flat looking like a toon character. 

7. Your can’t cancel a bow string pull by just releasing the L2 button, you have to dodge instead. 

8. There is major graphical clipping with capes and shields.

9. If you fall off a tall ledge the game’s camera literally rollercoasters you back to the path where you leaped off. 

10. Enemies get stuck and float in environment. 

11. Game uses too many particles that blind our screen, especially during boss battles. 

12. Dead zone for left analog stick is too large, and no slider option. 

I can probably go on for a bit more. 

I can see that it has improved some stuff with this 2.0 update. But overall this is one of the most amateur created games I’ve seen for a while. 

I think this game needs to hire some real professionals to fix all the mess.
snippet.textOriginal:
Lords of the Fallen, even with this 2.0 update, is not good. I think this game probably needs like another year.

My experience on PS5. 

1. Walking animations have shaky jitter. I even tried with different controllers and it was the same. 

2. Visceral attacks, the ones with the prompt, don’t always work, even when locked-on. I noticed this issue more on dogs. It was almost 50/50. 

3. If you mess with any setting the game will continue to ask if you want to save before progressing, even if you put setting back and didn’t make a change. 

4. The stock controller layouts for magic or projectiles are a mess. You have to spend time in the button re-map menu to make it right. 

5. Our character glitch appears with no shirt every single time on main menu. 

6. Knock down animation for our main character is straight up lazy and flat looking like a toon character. 

7. Your can’t cancel a bow string pull by just releasing the L2 button, you have to dodge instead. 

8. There is major graphical clipping with capes and shields.

9. If you fall off a tall ledge the game’s camera literally rollercoasters you back to the path where you leaped off. 

10. Enemies get stuck and float in environment. 

11. Game uses too many particles that blind our screen, especially during boss battles. 

12. Dead zone for left analog stick is too large, and no slider option. 

I can probably go on for a bit more. 

I can see that it has improved some stuff with this 2.0 update. But overall this is one of the most amateur created games I’ve seen for a while. 

I think this game needs to hire some real professionals to fix all the mess.

snippet.textDisplay:
The game still seems the same to me, it does look like they fixed some of the stability issues for single player, but multiplayer is still a problem, also the jumping isnt even a real jump, it's a hop, same hop you got from release, it's still awkward. There are still a ton of bugs, example: literally had another player who got stuck when interacting with a ladder could not really do anything but float in mid air, pressing the dodge button allowed them to move slightly, but the dodges were quickly canceled, it was hilarious honestly. Also when playing multiplayer lag can really ruin the experience, enemies won't react to attacks and sometimes you'll be attacked by an enemy from 90ft away with a charge attack, the problem with the "lag" is that with the people I play with, it's really rare that we lag at all, so I'm not sure as to what's going on.

Also one of the worse things when it comes to invasions, high level players can still invade low level players destroying them with all their late game gear, try doing a new character watch the invasions when in a multiplayer session, or play as your main and invade, it's ridiculous.

While I still like certain aspects of the game like, visual design, the armors and color edits, certain combat elements like the use of magic skills, boss designs, level designs, when I'm talking designs I'm talking about aesthetics. With that said, my view of the game barely changed, the game still has problems. Really hard to shake off the "ptsd" from the first time I played the game with the horribly abysmal performance, crashes,  and poor optimization. The game has been slightly improved, now after 2 years, but not enough to keep me around.

There are still a ton of bugs, example: literally had another player who got stuck when interacting with a ladder could not really do anything but float in mid air, pressing the dodge button allowed them to move slightly, but the dodges were quickly canceled, it was hilarious honestly. Also when playing multiplayer lag can really ruin the experience, enemies won't react to attacks and sometimes you'll be attacked by an enemy from 90ft away with a charge attack, the problem with the "lag" is that with the people I play with, it's really rare that we lag at all, so I'm not sure as to what's going on.

Also one of the worse things when it comes to invasions, high level players can still invade low level players destroying them with all their late game gear, try doing a new character watch the invasions when in a multiplayer session, or play as your main and invade, it's ridiculous.

While I still like certain aspects of the game like, visual design, the armors and color edits, certain combat elements like the use of magic skills, boss designs, level designs, when I'm talking designs I'm talking about aesthetics. With that said, my view of the game barely changed, the game still has problems. Really hard to shake off the "ptsd" from the first time I played the game with the horribly abysmal performance, crashes,  and poor optimization. The game has been slightly improved, now after 2 years, but not enough to keep me around.

snippet.textDisplay:
It's cool that they fixed the issues. But in my opinion:
Releasing a "souls-like" that's half baked, is like trying to compete with Ferrari but your engine is from a lawn mower.
One of the best things about fromsoft games, is you *know* it's going to be worth your money. Khazan was worth my money. Lies of P was worth my money. This... I Uninstalled instantly. I'd be willing to give it another shot. But it's disappointing they didn't just wait till it's finished.
snippet.textOriginal:

This game's character creator is somehow even worse than Fromsoftware's games xD
All jokes aside, it's incredible how much the game has improved since launch. I honestly believe that if it was developed on a proprietary engine instead of UE5 and if the story was a tad bit better, it would've been a smash hit. And after they even took a stance against DEI and wokeness, it's a guaranteed that I'm going to support them in the future. The game turned out really good in the end, I am really looking forward to these developers next projects.

snippet.textDisplay: This game didn't deserve nearly as much hate as it got at launch. The Devs were supporting the game from day one and everyone was giving them shit for it because "they were doing too many updates so the game must be bad/broken lol" and yet you see other studios like Larian get nothing but praise for how many updates they did for BG3 which also include a million bug fixes for broken content. I swear the Soulslike community went to hell with how mainstream ER was. LotF wasn't perfect at launch but there are games that were half as good that got twice the praise.
snippet.textOriginal: This game didn't deserve nearly as much hate as it got at launch. The Devs were supporting the game from day one and everyone was giving them shit for it because "they were doing too many updates so the game must be bad/broken lol" and yet you see other studios like Larian get nothing but praise for how many updates they did for BG3 which also include a million bug fixes for broken content. I swear the Soulslike community went to hell with how mainstream ER was. LotF wasn't perfect at launch but there are games that were half as good that got twice the praise.

snippet.textDisplay: Huge W for listening to gamers and making significant updates. It's refreshing to see a developer putting true heart and soul into their product, especially when it's not a live service micro transaction farmer. It honestly also says something that they sponsored baldy to play this game even after harsh (but honest) feedback. It shows humility and intelligence to be willing to take and even seek out criticism and react upon it.  I will be buying this today and watching this developer with keen interest for any future works. A sincere heartfelt thanks for doing what you do if you read this.
snippet.textOriginal: Huge W for listening to gamers and making significant updates. It's refreshing to see a developer putting true heart and soul into their product, especially when it's not a live service micro transaction farmer. It honestly also says something that they sponsored baldy to play this game even after harsh (but honest) feedback. It shows humility and intelligence to be willing to take and even seek out criticism and react upon it.  I will be buying this today and watching this developer with keen interest for any future works. A sincere heartfelt thanks for doing what you do if you read this.
